name: Mercury
description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun. It has a thin atmosphere and no moons.

name: Venus
description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun. It is the hottest planet in the Solar System due to its thick, toxic atmosphere.

name: Earth
description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known astronomical object to harbor life. It has one moon.

name: Mars
description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun. Known as the Red Planet, it has the largest volcano in the Solar System, Olympus Mons.

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System. It has a Great Red Spot, a giant storm that has been raging for hundreds of years.

name: Saturn
description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and is known for its spectacular ring system. It has over 80 moons.

name: Uranus
description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. It has a unique tilt, causing it to rotate on its side. Its atmosphere is mostly hydrogen and helium.

name: Neptune
description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest planet from the Sun. It is known for its strong winds and dark storm systems.

name: Pluto
description: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt. Once considered the ninth planet, it was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006.
